title: Charles Dickens: Black-and-white photos of author colourised
description: Colour has been digitally added to eight photos to show what the novelist would have looked like.

title: Women urged not to ignore chest pain during coronavirus pandemic
description: Melanie Connell, who underwent a triple bypass, urges women not to be afraid of seeking medical help.

title: How World in Motion heralded England's leap out of the dark ages
description: How New Order's World in Motion topped the charts 30 years ago, symbolising a "cultural revolution".

title: Coronavirus: No Botox and no fillers under lockdown
description: Living without fillers and Botox under lockdown is a mental health challenge for some individuals.

title: Asian hornet: UK beekeepers on lookout for bee-eater
description: The bee-eating Asian hornet has already reached the Channel Islands and beekeepers fear it could soon reach the UK mainland.

title: Coronavirus: 'Our son with Down's syndrome is thriving in lockdown'
description: Zachary, 4, has been hospitalised with chest infections many times, but his parents say he has never been so well.

title: Portraits of Humanity shortlist revealed
description: Two hundred shortlisted photos aim to show there is more that unites us than sets us apart.

title: Enjoying lockdown: 'Not having anything in my diary was a blessing in disguise'
description: For people whose diaries are usually full, the quarantine period has made them reassess their priorities.

title: Peter Crouch on jumping from planes and 'the ultimate retirement'
description: The retired footballer had to jump out of a plane for his new Saturday night BBC One show.

title: The Somali atheist activists who get death threats
description: Ayaanle and Kahaa work online to help Somalis who have views that do not square with tradition.

title: George Floyd protests: Trudeau's epic pause when asked about Trump's response
description: Asked about race, unrest and the US response, the Canadian prime minister chose his words carefully.

title: George Floyd protests: Misleading footage and conspiracy theories spread online
description: Protests after the death of George Floyd have led to a surge in misleading videos and unfounded theories.

title: Massive queues as McDonald's reopens Scottish drive-thru restaurants
description: Police have directed long queues of traffic at some Scottish McDonald's drive-thrus.

title: Coronavirus: London key workers to star on cover of British Vogue
description: Community midwife Rachel Millar describes being on the cover of Vogue as "surreal".

title: I don't feel safe in USA, says ex-Man City and QPR defender Onuoha
description: Former Manchester City defender Nedum Onuoha says he does not feel "100% safe" in the USA.

title: Coronavirus: Kenyan boy who made hand-washing machine awarded
description: Stephen Wamukota came up with a hand-washing machine that helps prevent the spread of Covid-19.

title: Coronavirus: Why we don't know how many are being tested
description: The UK Statistics Authority has criticised the government's handling of Covid-19 testing data.

title: How coronavirus tore through Britain's ethnic minorities
description: Covid-19 has affected BAME people disproportionately. Now they want to know why.

title: Coronavirus: What might swimming pools be like after lockdown?
description: Swimmers might have to arrive in their costumes, with limits on how many people can go in at a time.

title: George Floyd death: Trump's church visit shocks religious leaders
description: The divisive US president's visit to a church amid ongoing nationwide protests drew heavy criticism.

title: George Floyd death: Trump threatens to send in army to end unrest
description: As fury over a black man's killing by police continues, a top bishop condemns Mr Trump's actions.

title: Shielders face dilemma: Should I go outside or not?
description: People in England and Wales shielding with health conditions are able to leave home. Some don't want to.

title: Coronavirus: Ministers 'looking at ways to relax travel quarantine rule'
description: It comes after some MPs criticised the government's plan to quarantine people coming to the UK for 14 days.

title: Coronavirus: Government criticised over use of testing data
description: The head of the UK's statistics watchdog writes to Matt Hancock, saying data is "far from complete".

title: Premiership & Championship rugby union clubs to return to training
description: Premiership and Championship clubs are allowed to return to non-contact, socially-distanced training.

title: The Infinite Monkey Cage: BBC radio show trials virtual audience
description: Comedy series The Infinite Monkey Cage records its first episode with a live audience at home.

title: MPs to vote on future of virtual Commons
description: Politicians are split about how they can debate and vote in Parliament during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: House prices see largest monthly fall for 11 years, says Nationwide
description: The Nationwide says house prices fell 1.7% in May as the coronavirus crisis hit market activity.

title: George Floyd death: TV, radio and music industries mark 'Blackout Tuesday'
description: Broadcasters and the music industry reflect on the death of George Floyd in police custody last week.

title: Coronavirus: RSC postpones performances and events
description: The theatre company makes the "difficult decision" due to continuing social distancing rules.

title: Bundesliga: Timor Werner scores 25th goal of season for RB Leipzig in 4-2 win over Cologne
description: Timo Werner scores his 25th goal of the season in RB Leipzig's 4-2 won against Cologne in the first Bundesliga game to be played in June since 1995.

title: Mayweather offers to cover Floyd funeral costs
description: Former world champion Floyd Mayweather offers to pay the funeral costs of George Floyd, who died while being restrained by Minneapolis police.

title: Coronavirus: Deaths at lowest level since March
description: Over 2,500 deaths linked to virus in most recent week, but overall fatalities still higher than normal.

title: Formula 1 season to start with eight races in Europe
description: The 2020 Formula 1 season will start in Austria on 5 July, the first of a run of eight races in Europe.

title: Footballers should 'take a knee', says Kick It Out chair
description: Kick It Out chairman Sanjay Bhandari says footballers should "feel free" to protest over the death of George Floyd and "should take a knee".

title: Skateboarder Brown, 11, 'lucky to be alive' after horrific training fall
description: British skateboarder Sky Brown is "lucky to be alive" after a horrific fall from a ramp during training last week.

title: Coco, Marley and Me, and more movies to make you cry hard
description: A critic asked Twitter users for their top tear-jerking films, and was overwhelmed by the response.

title: The Papers: 'Revolt' over plan to quarantine arrivals to UK
description: The government's plan to make travellers quarantine for 14 days features on several front pages.

title: I have missed football so much it's unbelievable - Klopp
description: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp tells BBC Radio 5 Live he is "really happy to be back" to watch his "wonderful football team again".

title: George Floyd death: Why US protests resonate in the UK
description: British people explain why the death of George Floyd has had such a big impact in the UK.

title: How Europe's art world is welcoming back visitors
description: Some of Europe's best known art museums are reopening but it will be far from business as usual.

title: Coronavirus: The lockdown in Historic England pictures
description: Historic England has collected 200 pictures they say reflect the nation's coronavirus lockdown.

title: Coronavirus: The London hospital hit by a 'tidal wave' of patients
description: Northwick Park Hospital was overwhelmed with Covid patients. How did staff cope with the onslaught?
